treatment.description: Seta 3–6 mm, straight to some-what arcuate. Capsule when mature ovoid to narrowly ovoid, 3–5 mm, upper face with peri-meter ridge differentiating it from lower face, dull brown to greenish brown, not glossy. Spores 7–12 µm.
treatment.habitat: Commonly on rotten decorticated logs, but also on humus banks, mainly subalpine but also occasionally to near sea level, mainly in coniferous forests;
treatment.discussion: This endemic species may resemble Buxbaumia aphylla. The sporangium however, is never glossy chestnut when mature, but is dull and greenish brown; the exostome is in 2–3 rows rather than one row as in B. aphylla.
